result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Case for review to controller for cash bond adjusted down to $0 be refunded.

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

4:09 PM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rico D Cortinez in court.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for Rico D Cortinez. Court reviews charges/penalties thereof. 04:12 PM Deputy Zilke sworn and testifies. State rests. Defense rests. Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for trial. State files information. Counsel enters not guilty plea. 04:21 case recalled. Same appearances. Atty Boaz as to bail motion. Discussion held. Court converts cash bond to $2,500 signature bond w/ same conditions.
